title: @Repertoir What if Trundle's Attack Range were increased since his gameplay looks like Juggernaut ?
body:
Hello,

"Immobile, Powerful, Durable"

Although he's in a quite fine situation, a buff of his range would bring him in a better spot without making him overpowered.  Furthermore, he has a big mace !

He might need some balance changes about his MS granted by his W for instance, but since Juggernaut gameplay will be released, Trundle is in my opinion very similar to it.

What are your thoughts ?

replies.body:
Trundle to me is def a juggernaut. Immobile super tanky super damage melee guy. On top of that he is in a good spot design wise because he brings some pretty unique stuff to the team (tank buster ult) compared to other Juggs.

If he's needing buffs right now I would rather touch some other stuff like Movement speed, overall damage output, ability to soften tanks, or baseline tankiness (without items) over attack range. Increasing his attack range might muddy the gameplay of "kits this godlike melee or you will regret it" so I'd rather amp up his strengths and preserve his melee limitations.

Edit: added thought, if the real problem is that he has trouble getting to/sticking on targets, we could buff up some of the existing tools in his kit like E and W that help him with getting on enemies.

> Edit: added thought, if the real problem is that he has trouble getting to/sticking on targets, we could buff up some of the existing tools in his kit like E and W that help him with getting on enemies.

I think you could help him a lot by letting him ghost through minions and/or be immune to slows while on Frozen Domain.
Ghosting might be a good solution if we want to up the sticking power during W. Definitely something to consider.

What are your thoughts on unit collision in general? From what I understand, minion block was/is a means of preventing melee top laners from bullying each other too hard via straight-up assaults, but it's also a feature that the community severely dislikes due to its often unpredictable and not-too-intuitive nature. It's also an effect that's been seriously devalued over time, whether it be with unit collision removal on a large number of melee champions, or the massively increased number of dashes, both of which negate minion block completely while in use, bar certain colliding dashes. If you removed minion block, what would likely be the result? What would have to change?

I gotta say, while I know that Riot members always have their own opinions and sometimes see far less than eye to eye, over [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/YhwXAzem-riot-about-juggernauts) the other red said they saw trundle as a tank.  

Either way, if he was to be buffed, I'd love to see his pillar be more useful, right now its kinda just like--"here have a random slow zone".  I'd like it to have an AS slow with it.  or just make everything more crucial when on his frozen domain.  Maybe his ult also slows while both are on it, or his pillar slow zone is bigger on the domain, or his q is brief stun instead of slow while on it.  something more along those lines.

I think this is ok, and in some ways a good thing. Talking about general class frameworks like Juggernaut or Tank is useful but we aren't trying to homogenize our characters into cookie cutter like buckets. 

So in this case Trundle brings a mix of Juggernaut and Tank skills so he's somewhere in the grey space between those two clasees. IMO that's a good thing and these type of hybrid champs are what keep the league roster diverse.

How about making his Q get an extra 50 range?

I think his Q already has slightly increased range over his normal autos. This is something that we do for that little bit of feel on many attack resets. 

Though you may already know this and are asking for more. IMO there are better ways to improve trundle than giving Q longer than melee reach.

Would you say that Trundle has one of the best designs of any champion?

He has been balanced since inception around strong, identifiable gameplay patterns, strengths, and weaknesses, and until his soft thematic rework, he was almost untouched in balance changes.

I think Trundle deserves to be a poster child for Riot champion kit designers.

Trundle's problem is that he isn't good against more than 1 tank and he doesn't bring anything to a team beyond his pillar. Many other Tanks bring CC, AoE and Utility, all things he doesn't bring.

The thing is, his E and W arent enough for him to stick to the enemy. His Pillar can be amazing for disruption, but except in certain circumstances using it to catch isnt very likely.

His W is almost exclusively for the attack speed is most situations, because the enemy can just run out of it and keep kiting you.

I dont see how either could be changed to be useful for sticking power without breaking him entirely.

W and E are weak independently but if you actually put them together and pin enemies against walls with E, getting to them isn't hard unless you get creep blocked really hard (does happen a lot though) the 40% bonus MS while in W *is* a very big deal if you drop it on top of a fight since you can get around very easily and quickly within your little zone of power.
Assuming you get a wall pin with his E is a very big assumption. And cant be relied on for most fights.

Any fight in the jungle, most fights in side lanes, a lot of fights in mid lane. The only places it isn't super reliable to have a good wall is the center of mid lane, river, and inside your/the enemy's base. I'd say I can get a good wall pin in about 60-70% of fights.
Both side lanes, and many parts of the jungle are plenty wide enough to avoid being next to a wall to be pinned. REQUIRING you being near a choke point to stick to an enemy is part of his problem.

The last few times I played Trundle, I felt like his ult was a lot less impactful than normal, mainly because a lot of Trundle's Favorite items offer a lot of HP and health sustain and not much resistances. That would allow Trundle to more freely build items like the new titanic Hydra or Sterak's gage without being as quite as vulnerable to % health shred while ulting, without dramatically buffing him outside of his ult duration.
